title: Strengthening Business Competencies: Psychological Adaptation and Online Learning Adaptation for University Students in the COVID-19 Era

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of fundamental psychological concepts and experience using online learning tools
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can analyze three or more psychological stress factors caused by COVID-19 and develop coping strategies.

Learners create a personalized time management plan using the Pomodoro Technique or time-blocking method, consisting of 25-minute focused sessions + 5-minute breaks, at least five times per week in an online learning environment. They achieve an average adherence rate of 80% or higher over four weeks.

Learners collaborate in teams of 3–5 to develop one mobile-optimized learning content (for smartphones/tablets) using Problem-Based Learning (PBL). The content must meet: (1) ≥80% learners rate "Ease of Use" at 4+ (5-point scale), (2) ≥15% improvement in "Knowledge Acquisition" in effectiveness surveys, and (3) responsive design for all mobile environments.

Learners complete monthly formative assessment surveys and submit reflective journals (500+ characters) based on results. The journals must specify three or more psychological changes (stress, motivation, self-efficacy) and include two or more improvement plans.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
